availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Michigan soldier. Served in the 22nd Michigan Infantry (U.S.A.) as Private. Served in the 4th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from April 21, 1864 to February 20, 1865. Taken prisoner of war from July 30, 1864 near Lovejoy Station, Georgia until his escape December 16, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 186.
Find A Grave, "Henry P. Merrill (Mar 10, 1839-Nov 17, 1891)," Memorial #78611842, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78611842 (accessed August 6, 2020).
